comment.author: 69662531@N05
comment._content:
From the Commonwealth War Graves Commission website:

Name:OLIFENT, ELWIN BRUCE
Initials:E B
Nationality:Australian
Rank:Second Lieutenant
Regiment/Service:Australian Infantry, A.I.F.
Unit Text:27th Bn.
Age:29
Date of Death:05/11/1916
Additional information:Son of William Elwin and Frances Ellen Olifent. Born at Henley Beach, South Australia.
Casualty Type:Commonwealth War Dead
Memorial:VILLERS-BRETONNEUX MEMORIAL

comment.author: 69717788@N04
comment._content: •Name: Elwin Bruce Olifent •Sex: M •Birth: 18 APR 1886 in Adelaide, South Australia wc.rootsweb.ancestry.com/cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=GET&db=ju...

comment.author: 70176701@N02
comment._content:
Elwin Bruce Olifent. 27th Battalion of Henley Beach South Australia. A clerk prior to enlisting in Feb 1915. Olifent embarked from Adelaide with the 1st Reinforcements on board HMAT Geelong (A2) on 31 May 1915. He served in Gallipoli where he was promoted to Sergeant in Sept 1915. In France in August 1916 he was promoted to 2nd Lieutenant. 2nd LT Olifent was killed in action in France on Nov 5 1916. He was 29 years old.
Information from awm.gov.au
